channel.title: Glenn Deneve
channel.description: Contemporary Abstract Art by Glenn Deneve

item.title: GD Gallery | Purchase
item.content:encoded:
Purchase

 

Artwork prices range from $2,500 to $15,000.

How to Purchase 

Both original art work and prints can be purchased online from me.

If you are interested in an original piece, please use the ‘Contact’ link and provide me with the title of the artwork, your country and region, so that I can confirm the price for you. Delivery charges are applicable. I am always happy to provide you with any additional information you need, please just ask!

Payment

If you choose to go ahead and buy art work, I will provide you with an invoice.  Payments can be made by cash, PayPal or credit card. You will be charged as soon as your order is processed.  Artwork will not be shipped until funds have cleared.  All credit card transactions are made through either PayPal or Square, (all secure online payment systems). Please note that they do not share your financial information with me. 

Shipping, Packaging & Insurance

Artwork is dispatched within 3-5 working days, after payment has cleared and is fully insured (against damage or non-delivery) during transit. I mostly use FedEx for shipping and I take great care to ensure the work is well packed to avoid damage. Please contact me immediately, within 48 hours, if your artwork arrives damaged.  A replacement, exchange or a refund will be put in place.

Delivery

Depending on your location, delivery will normally be made within 10 working days of your confirmed purchase and cleared payment. You will receive an email regarding delivery date. Delivery times vary according to destination and carriers.

Customs and Excise duties

Purchases from some countries may attract duty charges. Responsibility for complying with the Customs & Excise procedures of the destination country and any levied duties, rests with the purchaser.  I can clarify this for you at the time of quoting, to ensure this is factored into the overall cost for the artwork.

Returns

If the paintings got damaged in transit, you will be reimbursed the full purchase value less all shipping costs once I have received the returned items. The item must be returned in its original condition within 7 days of delivery, in the original or other appropriate packaging, and appropriately insured with your carrier, otherwise I regret that I will be unable to provide a refund.

Copyright

The title of artwork ownership will pass to the purchaser upon cleared receipt of payment. Copyright of the artwork will remain with me, the artist. Artwork and designs must not be copied or reproduced in any way.

item.title: GDGallery | Bio
item.content:encoded:
Glenn Deneve was born in Bruges, Belgium. Growing up in one of the oldest and most magnificent cities of Europe, Glenn became keenly aware of life’s inherent splendor. Elements of his early home life helped shape his imagery providing a solid foundation for his artistic career.

From childhood Glenn was drawn to the United States and the creative vibe of California. In 1997 he moved to Los Angeles to pursue his dreams.

Glenn is drawn to nature, light, and the reflection of the sun on urban buildings – through a desire to uncover their harmony and beauty.

He explains: “Throughout the day I absorb the beauty I am surrounded by, with a conscious determination to eliminate any ugliness that might pop-up!! When I stand in front of the canvas, this influx of joy comes out of my system and flows unto the canvas in the form of bright colors, movements and shapes until it is fully expressed!! The process of painting is cathartic, a purification of the soul, it brings about a renewal of my inner self.”

Glenn is an artist who embodies the synthesis of his modern abstract sensitivities with sweeping palettes of color, and the atmospheric qualities of aesthetics and beauty. It is this fusion of color, spontaneity and representation that produces his rich and expressive body of work.

What makes Glenn’s work so appealing is his employment of engaging yet ambiguous imagery, which challenges viewers to approach his paintings from a very personal point of view. His seemingly impulsive combinations of forms and colors, scale and perspective, are always surprising and uplifting, and invite the viewer to personally process this visual information. One might find himself returning to Glenn’s paintings and encountering myriad subtleties that were not seen before.

Glenn developed his own textures and combinations of acrylic, watercolors and ink on canvas, wood panels and paper.

 

Bio
